mlp

Class LexiconUtility

  • java.lang.Object
    • mlp.LexiconUtility

  • public class LexiconUtility
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility class that has static methods for manipulating lexicons.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LexiconUtility() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods

      static java.lang.String collectionToString(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> col, java.lang.String inlineElementSep)
      Concatenates the String elements of the specified input collection, separating them with the specified inlineElementSep.
      static void createCleanFilesAndLexicons(java.lang.String referenceDataFolder)
      Reads an array of raw files from the raw-files folder in the specified reference data folder, and converts each raw version into a clean version and puts it in the clean files folder.
      static void getUnicodeMathStats(java.lang.String referenceDataFolder)
      Reads the file latex-and-unicode-raw.txt from the raw-files folder in the specfied reference data folder, cleans it, and puts the output in file latex-and-unicode-clean.txt.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LexiconUtility

        public LexiconUtility()

    • Method Detail

      • createCleanFilesAndLexicons

        public static void createCleanFilesAndLexicons(java.lang.String referenceDataFolder)
        Reads an array of raw files from the raw-files folder in the specified reference data folder, and converts each raw version into a clean version and puts it in the clean files folder. More importantly, it creates structured lexicons, one for each raw file, and puts it in the Lexicons folder.
        Parameters:
        referenceDataFolder - the folder which contains the various reference data subdirectories/sub-folders, which in turn contain various raw/clean reference files/lexicons.

      • getUnicodeMathStats

        public static void getUnicodeMathStats(java.lang.String referenceDataFolder)
        Reads the file latex-and-unicode-raw.txt from the raw-files folder in the specfied reference data folder, cleans it, and puts the output in file latex-and-unicode-clean.txt. Then, reads the file latex-and-unicode-clean.txt, and creates a structured file latex-and-unicode-Structured-DB.txt. Then, reports statistics about the unicode-math commands
        Parameters:
        referenceDataFolder - the folder which contains the various reference data subdirectories/sub-folders, which in turn contain various raw/clean reference files/lexicons.

      • collectionToString

        public static java.lang.String collectionToString(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> col,
                                                  java.lang.String inlineElementSep)
        Concatenates the String elements of the specified input collection, separating them with the specified inlineElementSep.
        Parameters:
        col - the input collection of String's to be concatenated
        inlineElementSep - the inlineElementSep separating between the collection's Strings in the final result
        Returns:
        the resulting concatenated string.
